questions.question_text: Which cloud storage type resembles a virtual hard drive and can be utilized in the same manner and with the same type of features and capabilities?
questions.answer_description: Volume storage is allocated and mounted as a virtual hard drive within IaaS implementations, and it can be maintained and used the same way a traditional file system can. Object storage uses a flat structure on remote services that is accessed via opaque descriptors, structured storage resembles database storage, and unstructured storage is used to hold auxiliary files in conjunction with applications hosted within a PaaS implementation.

One of the key advantages of Software as a Service (SaaS) is standardization, which helps organizations align with industry best practices and compliance baselines. SaaS providers often follow established frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA) and apply consistent security controls across all customers, reducing the compliance burden on individual organizations.

Why Not the Others?
A. Maintenance: While SaaS providers handle maintenance, this does not directly address compliance baselines.
B. Licensing: Licensing deals with software usage rights, not compliance management.
D. Development: SaaS users do not manage application development, so this is unrelated to compliance baselines.

Selected Answer: C
In a SaaS model, standardization refers to the consistent application of configurations, security baselines, and operational practices across the service. SaaS providers typically adhere to industry standards and regulatory frameworks (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS) to maintain compliance, alleviating the need for individual organizations to develop and enforce these baselines themselves.

A,B,D have NOTHING to do with baselines.

C. Standardization. SaaS providers often follow industry standards and regulations, which means that many compliance requirements, such as security baselines, are already integrated into the service. This standardization can significantly reduce the time and effort organizations spend on compliance.

questions.question_text:
Many tools and technologies are available for securing or monitoring data in transit within a data center, whether it is a traditional data center or a cloud.
Which of the following is NOT a technology for securing data in transit?
questions.answer_description: DNSSEC is an extension of the normal DNS protocol that enables a system to verify the integrity of a DNS query resolution by signing it from the authoritative source and verifying the signing chain. It is not used for securing data transmissions or exchanges. HTTPS is the most common method for securing web service and data calls within a cloud, and TLS is the current standard for encrypting HTTPS traffic. VPNs are widely used for securing data transmissions and service access.
